text: Interesting. I thought it would be better to recieve the human readable names + their values instead of the internal hs names. Maybe having both would be nice? <@U01QVR44MEY>
I'm assuming this is coming from wanting to take the data coming from fetchCrmObjectProperties and eventually send it to a serverless function?
Yeah exactly, Seth. Taking action on the data after showing to the user
not currently, you can do this with the Panel Component though!
It's an awesome component

Just to confirm:
• Right now, we send internal hs property names + values
• You'd like the human-readable `labels` seen here? :point_down: 
Or do I have it flipped
<@U01QVR44MEY> to get the labels right now you're hitting *`/crm/v3/properties/{objectType}/batch/read`* or something right?

yep yep, so like a dropdown is one example where the internal name might be lowercase and shortened but the label on the property is something that is nice, but right now when you request the property you get the internal value, which is a little tough.
So yeah you have to hit the batch read property endpoint, to get the details of the property

This is great I agree with Cameron.
One side question <@U01QVR44MEY> I have not seen anything ANYWHERE on the development documentation about needing to opt into the Beta for this all to become enabled.
Did I miss this somewhere or is there any way this should be pushed to update the documentation?

No you're not missing something, this hasn't been spelled out in the documentation very well, it's definitely something I know the team is thinking about. <@U05ENUJF7B5> might be able to give you some insight
Thank you though, for this. I was stranded and it didn't make sense until I found this thread!
yep yep, totally get it!
<@U01QVR44MEY> would love to see how youre using it :slightly_smiling_face:
Is there a way to remove the Footer in the UI Ext Custom Cards?
Hahaha, nope
